attr.q: Show that the collection \mathcal{U}, where \mathcal{U}=\{ U( f,\varepsilon ) :f\in C[0,1] \text{and } \varepsilon \text{ is a positive real number} \} and U(f,\varepsilon) =\{ g:g\in C[ 0,1] \text{ and } \sup _{x\in [ 0,1] } \| f(x) -g( x) \| <\varepsilon \} is a basis for a topology \tau_2 on C[0,1]
attr.a: Its also a metric on a function space. Please refer to the example 6.1.6
